alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlingen, San Benito, Los Fresnos, Rio Hondo, Laureles, Brownsville, Lozano, Library Memorial Middle School, Palmer Laasko Elementary, Rio Hondo High School, Los Fresnos High School, Resaca Middle School, Lopez - Riggins Elementary School, Los Cuates, Rio Hondo Junior High School, Los Fresnos City Offices, Rio Hondo City Hall, Rio Hondo Elementary School, Downs Elementary School and Miller Jordan Middle School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
